page.title: 10Dairy Farm 1:The Deverills
page.content: {Mill Farm}was mentioned in the {Domesday Book}as one of the two{water {mills}on the River Wylye in{Hill {Deverill.}The old stone mill is now a farmhouse, the old mill pond is now used by a Cress Farm. As a farm it has been in the same family for three generations. Mill farm is 56 acres with further land at Crockerton. Of this 5O acres are grass keep, 6 acres are fodder beet, 6 acres of kale, also fodder wheat is grown and the farmer makes hay and silage. The farmer has 57 Friesian dairy cows and 5O followers, of these 4O are heifers for herd replacement and there are 1O beef calves. The dairy cows produce on average 85O litres of milk a day. The farmer has cut back milk production to meet Common Market milk quotas by feeding less cattle cake.
